meanings.definition: To accept something undesirable but inevitable
meanings.sent1: She resigned herself to the fact that it would rain on her birthday.
meanings.sent2: He resigned to the fact that he had to wake up early for work.
meanings.sent3: The cat resigned to taking a bath, knowing it was inevitable.
meanings.sent4: The student resigned to the reality of having to study for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The hiker resigned to the challenging trail ahead, knowing it was the only way back.

meanings.definition: To formally give up a position or job
meanings.sent1: After many years of service, she resigned from her role as manager.
meanings.sent2: He resigned from the company to pursue his passion for painting.
meanings.sent3: The robot resigned from its duties, leaving the factory in chaos.
meanings.sent4: The captain resigned from his post, passing the leadership to his successor.
meanings.sent5: She resigned from the committee, feeling it was time for new voices to be heard.

meanings.sent1: Her resigned expression indicated she had given up arguing.
meanings.sent2: The dog's resigned demeanor showed he had accepted his fate.
meanings.sent3: The resigned attitude of the defeated team was evident in their body language.
meanings.sent4: His resigned tone suggested he had come to terms with the situation.
meanings.sent5: The resigned look on her face revealed her surrender to the inevitable outcome.
